page.title: 01SURVEY OF BONNYRIGG AREA
page.content: Our block consists of two small towns, {Bonnyrigg}and{Loanhead,}as well as farmland. The{River North Esk}flows through the area in a North Easterly direction towards Musselburgh where it flows into the{River Forth.}Bonnyrigg and Loanhead developed and grew from small{coal-mining}villages, with{paper and{carpet manufacturing}at one time providing the other main sources of employment. With the closure of these factories they are now mainly {residential}towns, a large percentage of the population travelling to {Edinburgh}for work. Many new houses in both public and private sectors have been built in the last 20 years to accommodate people who wish to live near, but not in, Edinburgh. With no special tourist attractions the population remains fairly stable all the year round.
